author: Odeinoichus
title: Chief O'Hara, Activate the Bat Signal!
review:
Set #853651 The LEGO Batman Movie Accessory Set: This is another LEGO store exclusive featuring three Minifigures and a small model build of a Batsignal, it is designed to present a few characters not currently available in any other sets. As such you won’t find much to discuss, but I will do my best to go over the key elements of this set.

Packaging

Available on a blister card back this set’s packaging isn’t much to talk about either. The yellow card features the movie logo and some pictures on the side of Gotham City streets, the central section of the card is a yellow rectangular pattern which looks slightly ugly, compared to other accessory sets where the back of the card features a fully realized art image, this one is definitely lacking.

The back makes up for this as you can see the full shot of the Gotham City street with the set on full display.

Minifigures

Chief O’Hara: The only officially named character in the set features a unique torso with double-sided printing and some minor printing on the legs for her belt and badge, her face is set in a perpetually scowling expression as it is not dual-sided and she has a dark brown version of, I believe, the CMF Grandma hair piece. Her accessory is the space pistol.

GCPD Officer 1: Officer 1 is a dark skinned character with a regular police hat, a pair of handcuffs and a nicely printed torso with dual-sided printing. The dark blue colouring of the plastic makes it difficult to tell, but he does feature some printing and they are dual-molded for his black boots.

GCPD Officer 2: Representing a motorcycle cop, judging by the Bad Cop helmet piece he’s using for head gear, this figure has a different torso design with dual sided printing, he features a single-sided face and like the other officer there is side-printing on one shoulder for the GCPD shield. He gets a pair of binoculars for an accessory.

The model

A small Batsignal model is included with this accessory set and there’s not much to say about it. It is basically a printed tile of the Bat symbol with a large dome piece over it. The build is fairly simple and the design is a bit lacking compared to other models seen in the Theme, it can fully rotate at least.

Overall opinion

This is great for collectors who want to get more Minifigures for their LEGO Batman Movie collection, especially Chief O’Hara who was a fun character in the film. Overall though I’m not sure if the price for this set is worth it, especially as the model Batsignal has better options from other sets in the Theme. I’d mildly recommend this set, it’s great the Minifigures, but the rest is a bit disappointing.

author: redbeardlegoman
title: The signal goes on and he shows up.
review:
Summary

A bat signal, a couple of GCPD officers, and Chief O'Hara.  Perhaps a touch pricey, but still worthwhile.

Box/Instructions

As with most recent accessory packs, this comes on a blister card.  I never saved them on my He-Man figures, and it's no different with these.  Rip.  Toss.  Build.

The Instructions are on a folded sheet.  I rarely say anything about instructions, but today I shall.

I've never liked the folded sheet instructions for polybags or small sets.  I don't know if a tiny stapled booklet is feasible, but I'd like to see something different.  The folded sheets don't sit well in storage until they've been squashed under the complete Usagi Yojimbo graphic novel library for a year.

Parts

I love the motorcycle helmet, and Chief O'Hara's hair now being available in black.

And there is something aesthetically pleasing about the dome of the bat signal.  If it's not too weird to love the look of a good single piece, then let me say that I love these half-spheres.  I think they've always added a great look to any build.

Minifigures

I think the head and helmet of the motorcycle cop will help me to perfect my LEGO Village People.  

The other officer is simply well-executed.  And, since he doesn't have any GCPD on his uniform, he could easily be used for, say a Police Academy graduation ceremony MOC.

As for Chief O'Hara, I'm always happy to have another actual character to add to my Gotham City display.  I especially love her tired eyes, and the badge worn on the hip.

The Build

The minfigures are already built - saving you upwards of ten seconds.  The bat signal itself does not take very long to build.  I think, though, that it's simplicity lends itself well to the completed model.  In a few steps we have an instantly recognizable bat signal.  If you don't have/can't afford/can't find either the 70917 Ultimate Batmobile, or the 5004930 Accessory Pack, both of which are superior bat signals in my mind, then this is a great alternative.

It also has the advantage of being easier for younger or less-developed builders to assemble, and then add to the roof of the GCPD HQ.  

Which reminds me, I have to dig out a spare turn-table piece...

The Completed Model / Overall Opinion

The bat signal looks good, if not great.  The three cops are wonderful for fleshing out Gotham's Finest. 

It is, however, a bit on the pricey side, and that could put you off.  If you can find it on clearance, then it's totally worth picking up. 

Needless to say, completists (like me) will have to get it. 

There are better bat signals out there (and worse - I'm looking at you 76044 Clash of the Heroes), but they tend to be in hard-to-find and/or expensive sets.  For kids and the fiscally limited, this is a fair compromise.

author: brickengineeringdude
title: Excellent!
review:
What's Included

-Police officer with hat: This guy has an awesome face print, The hat looks great, and the torso and leg printing are also great with a printed arm with a badge and dual-molded legs. It's nice to get a reddish brown minifig head because these are pretty rare.

-Police officer with helmet: This guy's face print looks okay,(I've never seen a beard like this) but the helmet is nice, as well as the torso which has GCPD printed on the back which I guess stands for "Gotham City Police Department". 

-Detective: (I think) The hair is nice, the face print , the torso has a printed holster that's to-scale and way out of scale compared to the gun included. the legs are printed with a belt and badge, and the minifigure looks good overall.   

The Bat-signal (I think that's what it's called) looks good, a trans-clear dome would have been better and looked more like a light. You do get a 2x2 round plate with bat logo, and the pneumatic hose connectors are useful.

The three accessories are: 

An (Alien Conquest?) gun, and I think there's only one other police set with a gun, 853570.

Binoculars in dark bluish gray,

and handcuffs.

I recommend buying this set, but with a discount would be better. I recently bought this set at LEGO Shop at Home, on a discount.
